title: Standard spellbook

properties.name: description
properties.value: The standard spellbook are a group of Magic spells available to all players, being unlocked by default upon character creation. Standard spells make use of all runes except Astral. Staves are also required to cast some of the spells, including Iban's staff, slayer's staff or staff of the dead, Saradomin staff or staff of light, Zamorak staff, and Guthix staff or void knight mace.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Standard spellbook
The standard spellbook.

The standard spellbook are a group of Magic spells available to all players, being unlocked by default upon character creation. Standard spells make use of all runes except Astral. Staves are also required to cast some of the spells, including Iban's staff, slayer's staff or staff of the dead, Saradomin staff or staff of light, Zamorak staff, and Guthix staff or void knight mace.

Magic spells are divided into three distinct types: Combat, Utility, and Teleport spells.

Contents

  • 1 Combat spells
    • 1.1 Offensive spells
    • 1.2 Curse spells
    • 1.3 Support spells
  • 2 Teleport spells
  • 3 Utility spells
    • 3.1 Alchemy spells
    • 3.2 Enchantment spells
    • 3.3 Enchant Crossbow Bolt
    • 3.4 Other spells
  • 4 Trivia

Combat spells[edit | edit source]

Offensive spells[edit | edit source]

Offensive spells such as Water Strike and Fire Blast are simple: They deal damage to one target, with the amount of damage varying according to the spell's maximum hit and other modifiers. The accuracy of these spells is determined by a number of factors, none of which are the spell itself; all other things being equal. There are four main elements for combat spells in the standard spellbook: wind (air), water, earth, and fire. Additionally, there are five increasingly strong groups of spells: strike spells, bolt spells, blast spells, wave spells, and surge spells. Among these groups, wind spells are always the weakest, and fire spells are always the strongest. The elements themselves do not seem to affect much except in a few circumstances; for example, water spells are twice as effective on lava beasts.

In addition to the elemental spells, there are a number of unique combat spells with different properties. Iban Blast requires that Iban's staff be equipped to use it, and casts of Iban Blast drain charges on the staff until it must eventually be recharged; however, it hits extremely hard for the level required to use it. Magic Dart uses no elemental runes, instead using only death runes and mind runes, and has a maximum hit determined by the caster's Magic level. Each of the god spells has a secondary effect upon a successful hit.

Compared to melee and Ranged, some lower-levelled offensive spells have exceptionally high maximum hits for the levels required to cast them. For example, Fire Strike can hit up to 8 damage at a mere level 13 Magic, which is not possible (assuming reasonably consistent skill levels) with either melee or Ranged.

Icon Mobile
icon 		Spell Level Runes XP Base Max hit[1] Members
Wind Strike 1 1 1 5.5 2 0
Water Strike 5 1 1 1 7.5 4 0
Earth Strike 9 1 2 1 9.5 6 0
Fire Strike 13 2 3 1 11.5 8 0
Wind Bolt 17 2 1 13.5 9 0
Water Bolt 23 2 2 1 16.5 10 0
Earth Bolt 29 2 3 1 19.5 11 0
Fire Bolt 35 3 4 1 22.5 12 0
Crumble Undead 39 2 2 1 24.5 15 0
Wind Blast 41 3 1 25.5 13 0
Water Blast 47 3 3 1 28.5 14 0
Iban Blast 50 5 1 + 30 25 1
Magic Dart 50 1 4 + 30 15 1
Earth Blast 53 3 4 1 31.5 15 0
Fire Blast 59 4 5 1 34.5 16 0
Saradomin Strike 60 4 2 2 + 35 20 1
Flames of Zamorak 60 1 4 2 + 35 20 1
Claws of Guthix 60 4 1 2 + 35 20 1
Wind Wave 62 5 1 36 17 1
Water Wave 65 5 7 1 37.5 18 1
Earth Wave 70 5 7 1 40 19 1
Fire Wave 75 5 7 1 42.5 20 1
Wind Surge 81 7 1 44.5 21 1
Water Surge 85 7 10 1 46.5 22 1
Earth Surge 90 7 10 1 48.5 23 1
Fire Surge 95 7 10 1 50.5 24 1
  1. ^ Max hit may be increased by using equipment which increases magic damage.

Curse spells[edit | edit source]

Curse spells are combat spells that are primarily used to temporarily lower the target's stats or prevent movement. As Magic is meant to be strong against melee users, the various curse spells lower Attack, Strength, and Defence by either 5% or 10%. Additionally, Tele Block may be classified as a curse spell, although it prevents teleportation rather than lowering a stat.

Curse spells do not stack with themselves or similar curses; for example, it is not possible to frequently cast Stun on a target to drain its Attack further than 10%, nor is it possible to cast Confuse afterward for an additional 5% drain.

Icon Mobile
icon 		Spell Level Runes XP Members Effect
Confuse 3 2 3 1 13 0
 Reduces the target's Attack by 5%.
Weaken 11 2 3 1 21 0
 Reduces the target's Strength by 5%.
Curse 19 3 2 1 29 0
 Reduces the target's Defence by 5%.
Bind 20 3 3 2 30 0
 Prevents the target from moving for 4.8 seconds.
Snare 50 4 4 3 60 0
 Prevents the target from moving for 9.6 seconds.
Vulnerability 66 5 5 1 76 1
 Reduces the target's Defence by 10%.
Enfeeble 73 8 8 1 83 1
 Reduces the target's Strength by 10%.
Entangle 79 5 5 4 89 1
 Prevents the target from moving for 14.4 seconds.
Stun 80 12 12 1 90 1
 Reduces the target's Attack by 10%.
Tele Block 85 1 1 1 80 0
 Prevents the target from teleporting for five minutes (half if they are using Protect from Magic).

Support spells[edit | edit source]

Support spells offer a range of benefits to the caster, such as increasing damage, curing poison, and healing other players. However, the standard spellbook only offers one support spell, which increases damage for god spells.

Icon Mobile
icon 		Spell Level Runes XP Members
Charge 80 3 3 3 180 1

Teleport spells[edit | edit source]

The standard spellbook contains a number of teleport spells, which instantly transport the caster to a certain destination. These spells are popular as they offer a considerably faster method of transportation than walking everywhere, and several of them, such as Varrock Teleport, lead to popular areas of the map. Free players may access all teleport spells up to and including Falador Teleport. All teleport spells use law runes in addition to other runes.

The standard spellbook is also the only spellbook to feature teleother spells (although the Lunar spellbook has 'Tele Group' spells). When cast on another player, these spells will teleport that player to a certain destination. However, the targeted player must have Accept Aid on, and will be asked whether they wish to accept the teleportation. All teleother spells use soul runes in addition to law runes.

Icon Mobile
icon 		Spell Level Runes XP Members Notes
Lumbridge Home Teleport 0 None 0 0
 Teleports the player to Lumbridge. It can only used once every 30 minutes and can be interrupted by combat.
Varrock Teleport 25 3 1 1 35 0
 Teleports the caster to the market square in Varrock.
Lumbridge Teleport 31 3 1 1 41 0
 Teleports the caster to the courtyard of Lumbridge Castle.
Falador Teleport 37 3 1 1 47 0
 Teleports the caster to the centre of Falador.
Teleport to House 40 1 1 1 30 1
 Teleports the caster to their player-owned house. This spell's destination can either be the exit portal inside the house itself, or outside the entrance portal.
Camelot Teleport 45 5 1 55.5 1
 Teleports the caster to the gates of Camelot.
Ardougne Teleport 51 2 2 61 1
 Requires completion of Plague City. Teleports the caster to the market square in East Ardougne.
Watchtower Teleport 58 2 2 68 1
 Requires completion of Watchtower Quest. Teleports the caster to the top of the Watchtower outside of Yanille.
Trollheim Teleport 61 2 2 68 1
 Requires completion of Eadgar's Ruse. Teleports the caster to the top of Trollheim.
Ape Atoll Teleport 64 2 2 2 1 74 1
 Requires completion of the Freeing King Awowogei sub-quest of Recipe for Disaster. Teleports the caster to a safe area in the Temple of Marimbo.
Kourend Castle Teleport 69 5 4 2 2 82 1
 Requires reading the book transportation incantations. Teleports the caster to the Kourend Castle courtyard.
Teleother Lumbridge 74 1 1 1 84 1
 Teleports another player, who must have Accept Aid on, to the courtyard of Lumbridge Castle.
Teleother Falador 82 1 1 1 92 1
 Teleports another player, who must have Accept Aid on, to the centre of Falador.
Teleport to Target 85 1 1 1 45 1
 Teleports the player to an assigned target in the Wilderness. Can only be cast on target worlds.
Teleother Camelot 90 1 2 100 1
 Teleports another player, who must have Accept Aid on, to the gates of Camelot.

Utility spells[edit | edit source]

Utility spells are spells that are typically used outside of combat, such as enchanting items.

Alchemy spells[edit | edit source]

Alchemy spells convert items into other items. Including the following: Low Level Alchemy and High Level Alchemy convert items into certain amounts of coins, and Superheat Item may be used to forge ore into bars without a furnace. These three spells all use nature runes and fire runes. Standard magic also includes; Bones to Bananas, and Bones to Peaches, which use Nature, Earth, and, Water runes.

Icon Mobile
icon 		Spell Level Runes XP Members Effect
Bones to Bananas 15 2 2 1 25 0
 Converts all normal bones in the inventory into bananas.
Low Level Alchemy 21 3 1 31 0
 Gives coins equal to ⌊ 0.4 × Value ⌋ {\displaystyle \left\lfloor 0.4\times {\text{Value}}\right\rfloor } of the item the spell was cast on.
Superheat Item 43 4 1 53 0
 Smelts ore into bars without need of a furnace. Iron ore's success rate is 100% when used with this spell.
High Level Alchemy 55 5 1 65 0
 Gives coins equal to ⌊ 0.6 × Value ⌋ {\displaystyle \left\lfloor 0.6\times {\text{Value}}\right\rfloor } of the item the spell was cast on.
Bones to Peaches 60 2 4 2 65 1
 Converts all normal bones in the inventory into peaches. Must be unlocked at the Mage Training Arena.

Enchantment spells[edit | edit source]

Enchantment spells imbue certain items with magical properties, giving them new abilities. Any piece of jewellery crafted with a gem may be enchanted by the proper Enchant Jewellery spell. Enchanted jewellery items have a wide variety of effects, such as teleportation, increased equipment bonuses, and assistance in skills such as Smithing and Runecraft. Additionally, the Charge Orb spells may be used to imbue unpowered orbs with elemental magic, after which they may be used to make elemental staves. All enchantment spells make use of cosmic runes.

Icon Mobile
icon 		Spell Level Runes XP Members Effect
Lvl-1 Enchant 7 1 1 17.5 0
 Enchants jewellery made from sapphire and opal.
Lvl-2 Enchant 27 3 1 37 0
 Enchants jewellery made from emerald and jade.
Lvl-3 Enchant 49 5 1 59 0
 Enchants jewellery made from ruby and red topaz.
Charge Water Orb 56 30 3 1 56 1
 Enchants an unpowered orb into a water orb when cast at the Obelisk of Water.
Lvl-4 Enchant 57 10 1 67 0
 Enchants jewellery made from diamond.
Charge Earth Orb 60 30 3 1 70 1
 Enchants an unpowered orb into an earth orb when cast at the Obelisk of Earth.
Charge Fire Orb 63 30 3 1 73 1
 Enchants an unpowered orb into a fire orb when cast at the Obelisk of Fire.
Charge Air Orb 66 30 3 1 76 1
 Enchants an unpowered orb into an air orb when cast at the Obelisk of Air.
Lvl-5 Enchant 68 15 15 1 78 1
 Enchants jewellery made from dragonstone.
Lvl-6 Enchant 87 20 20 1 97 1
 Enchants jewellery made from onyx.
Lvl-7 Enchant 93 20 1 20 110 1
 Enchants jewellery made from zenyte.

Enchant Crossbow Bolt[edit | edit source]

Crossbow bolts with tips made from gems may be enchanted by members with the proper Enchant Crossbow Bolt spell, where they then gain secondary effects in combat.

Icon Spell Level Runes XP Members Notes
Enchant Crossbow Bolt (Opal) 4 2 1
10 		9 1
 Enchants opal bolts into opal bolts (e), 10 at a time.
Enchant Crossbow Bolt (Sapphire) 7 1 1 1
10 		17.5 1
 Enchants sapphire bolts into sapphire bolts (e), 10 at a time.
Enchant Crossbow Bolt (Jade) 14 2 1
10 		19 1
 Enchants jade bolts into jade bolts (e), 10 at a time.
Enchant Crossbow Bolt (Pearl) 24 2 1
10 		29 1
 Enchants pearl bolts into pearl bolts (e).
Enchant Crossbow Bolt (Emerald) 27 3 1 1
10 		37 1
 Enchants emerald bolts into emerald bolts (e), 10 at a time.
Enchant Crossbow Bolt (Red Topaz) 29 2 1
10 		33 1
 Enchants topaz bolts into topaz bolts (e), 10 at a time.
Enchant Crossbow Bolt (Ruby) 49 5 1 1
10 		59 1
 Enchants ruby bolts into ruby bolts (e), 10 at a time.
Enchant Crossbow Bolt (Diamond) 57 10 1 2
10 		67 1
 Enchants diamond bolts into diamond bolts (e), 10 at a time.
Enchant Crossbow Bolt (Dragonstone) 68 15 1 1
10 		78 1
 Enchants dragonstone bolts into dragonstone bolts (e), 10 at a time.
Enchant Crossbow Bolt (Onyx) 87 20 1 1
10 		97 1
 Enchants onyx bolts into onyx bolts (e), 10 at a time.

Other spells[edit | edit source]

Icon Mobile
icon 		Spell Level Runes XP Members Effect
Telekinetic Grab 33 1 1 43 0
 Remotely takes an item laying on the ground or on a table. Can be cast through barriers such as fences and jail cell bars, but not through solid objects like doors or walls.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Within the game cache, there are three unused spell icons that can be found ( ). These were scrapped summoning spells from RuneScape Classic that utilised life runes, which were also scrapped.
  • There is also one unused mobile spell icon within the game cache, which is the icon for Restraint, a level 89 spell costing 5 Wrath, 10 Fire and 10 Earth runes per cast, capable of hitting up to 8 damage and being able to freeze a single opponent for 20 seconds. This spell was offered in the Revenant Cave Rewards: Revisited & Content Changes Poll, but failed by 3.3% votes.

curing poison, and healing other players. However, the standard spellbook only offers one support spell, which increases damage for [[god spells]]. {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center; width:500px;" !class="unsortable"|Icon ! class="unsortable" |[[Mobile]]
icon !Spell !Level !class="unsortable"|[[Runes]] !XP ![[Members]] |- |[[File:Charge.png]] |[[File:Charge icon (mobile).png]] |[[Charge]] |80 |{{RuneReq|Air=3|Fire=3|Blood=3}} |180 |{{members|yes}} |} ==Teleport spells== The standard spellbook contains a number of [[teleport spells]], which instantly transport the caster to a certain destination. These spells are popular as they offer a considerably faster method of transportation than walking everywhere, and several of them, such as [[Varrock Teleport]], lead to popular areas of the map. Free players may access all teleport spells up to and including [[Falador Teleport]]. All teleport spells use [[law rune]]s in addition to other runes. The standard spellbook is also the only spellbook to feature teleother spells (although the Lunar spellbook has '[[Tele Group]]' spells). When cast on another player, these spells will teleport that player to a certain destination. However, the targeted player must have [[Accept Aid]] on, and will be asked whether they wish to accept the teleportation. All teleother spells use soul runes in addition to law runes. {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center; width:850px;" !class="unsortable"|Icon ! class="unsortable" |[[Mobile]]

It can only used once every 30 minutes and can be interrupted by combat. |- |[[File:Varrock Teleport.png]] |[[File:Varrock Teleport icon (mobile).png]] |[[Varrock Teleport]] |25 |{{RuneReq|Law=1|Air=3|Fire=1}} |35 |{{members|no}} | style="text-align: left;" | Teleports the caster to the market square in [[Varrock]]. |- |[[File:Lumbridge Teleport.png]] |[[File:Lumbridge Teleport icon (mobile).png]] |[[Lumbridge Teleport]] |31 |{{RuneReq|Law=1|Air=3|Earth=1}} |41 |{{members|no}} | style="text-align: left;" | Teleports the caster to the courtyard of [[Lumbridge Castle]]. |- |[[File:Falador Teleport.png]] |[[File:Falador Teleport icon (mobile).png]] |[[Falador Teleport]] |37 |{{RuneReq|Law=1|Air=3|Water=1}} |47 |{{members|no}} | style="text-align: left;" | Teleports the caster to the centre of [[Falador]]. |- |[[File:Teleport to House.png]] |[[File:Teleport to House icon (mobile).png]] |[[Teleport to House]] |40 |{{RuneReq|Law=1|Air=1|Earth=1}} |30 |{{members|yes}} | style="text-align: left;" | Teleports the caster to their [[player-owned house]]. Teleports the caster to the top of [[Trollheim]]. |- |[[File:Ape Atoll Teleport (standard).png]] |[[File:Ape Atoll Teleport (standard) icon (mobile).png]] |[[Ape Atoll Teleport (standard)|Ape Atoll Teleport]] |64 |{{RuneReq|Law=2|Fire=2|Water=2}}1[[File:Banana.png|link=Banana]] |74 |{{members|yes}} | style="text-align: left;" | Requires completion of the [[Freeing King Awowogei]] sub-quest of [[Recipe for Disaster]]. Teleports the caster to a safe area in the [[Temple of Marimbo]]. |- |[[File:Kourend Castle Teleport.png]] |[[File:Kourend Castle Teleport icon (mobile).png]] |[[Kourend Castle Teleport]] |69 |{{RuneReq|Soul=2|Law=2|Fire=5|Water=4}} |82 |{{members|yes}} | style="text-align: left;" | Requires reading the book [[transportation incantations]]. Teleports the caster to the [[Kourend Castle]] courtyard. |- |[[File:Teleother Lumbridge.png]] |[[File:Teleother Lumbridge icon (mobile).png]] |[[Teleother Lumbridge]] |74 |{{RuneReq|Law=1|Soul=1|Earth=1}} |84 |{{members|yes}} | style="text-align: left;" | Teleports another player, who must have [[Accept Aid]] on, to the courtyard of Lumbridge Castle. |- |[[File:Teleother Falador.png]] |[[File:Teleother Falador icon (mobile).png]] |[[Teleother Falador]] |82 |{{RuneReq|Law=1|Soul=1|Water=1}} |92 |{{members|yes}} | style="text-align: left;" | Teleports another player, who must have [[Accept Aid]] on, to the centre of Falador. |- |[[File:Teleport to Target.png]] |[[File:Teleport to Target icon (mobile).png]] |[[Teleport to Target]] |85 |{{RuneReq|Law=1|Death=1|Chaos=1}} |45 |{{members|yes}} | style="text-align: left;" | Teleports the player to an assigned target in the [[Wilderness]]. Can only be cast on target worlds. |- |[[File:Teleother Camelot.png]] |[[File:Teleother Camelot icon (mobile).png]] |[[Teleother Camelot]] |90 |{{RuneReq|Law=1|Soul=2}} |100 |{{members|yes}} | style="text-align: left;" | Teleports another player, who must have [[Accept Aid]] on, to the gates of Camelot. |} ==Utility spells== Utility spells are spells that are typically used outside of combat, such as enchanting items. ===Alchemy spells=== Alchemy spells convert items into other items. Including the following: [[Low Level Alchemy]] and [[High Level Alchemy]] convert items into certain amounts of coins, and [[Superheat Item]] may be used to forge [[ore]] into [[bar]]s without a [[furnace]]. These three spells all use nature runes and fire runes. Standard magic also includes; [[Bones to Bananas]], and [[Bones to Peaches]], which use Nature, Earth, and, Water runes. {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center; width:850px;" !class="unsortable"|Icon ! class="unsortable" |[[Mobile]]
icon !Spell !Level !class="unsortable"|[[Runes]] !XP ![[Members]] !Effect |- |[[File:Bones to Bananas.png]] |[[File:Bones to Bananas icon (mobile).png]] |[[Bones to Bananas]] |15 |{{RuneReq|Water=2|Earth=2|Nature=1}} |25 |{{members|no}} | style="text-align: left;" | Converts all normal [[bones]] in the inventory into [[banana]]s. |- |[[File:Low Level Alchemy.png]] |[[File:Low Level Alchemy icon (mobile).png]] |[[Low Level Alchemy]] |21 |{{RuneReq|Nature=1|Fire=3}} |31 |{{members|no}} | style="text-align: left;" | Gives [[coins]] equal to \left \lfloor 0.4 \times \text{Value} \right \rfloor of the item the spell was cast on. |- |[[File:Superheat Item.png]] |[[File:Superheat Item icon (mobile).png]] |[[Superheat Item]] |43 |{{RuneReq|Fire=4|Nature=1}} |53 |{{members|no}} | style="text-align: left;" | Smelts [[ore]] into [[bars]] without need of a [[furnace]]. [[Iron ore]]'s success rate is 100% when used with this spell. |- |[[File:High Level Alchemy.png]] |[[File:High Level Alchemy icon (mobile).png]] |[[High Level Alchemy]] |55 |{{RuneReq|Fire=5|Nature=1}} |65 |{{members|no}} | style="text-align: left;" | Gives [[coins]] equal to \left \lfloor 0.6 \times \text{Value} \right \rfloor of the item the spell was cast on. |- |[[File:Bones to Peaches.png]] |[[File:Bones to Peaches icon (mobile).png]] |[[Bones to Peaches]] |60 |{{RuneReq|Water=4|Earth=2|Nature=2}} |65 |{{members|yes}} | style="text-align: left;" | Converts all normal [[bones]] in the inventory into [[peach]]es. Must be unlocked at the [[Mage Training Arena]]. |} ===Enchantment spells=== Enchantment spells imbue certain items with magical properties, giving them new abilities. Any piece of [[jewellery]] crafted with a [[gem]] may be enchanted by the proper Enchant Jewellery spell. [[Enchanted jewellery|Enchanted jewellery items]] have a wide variety of effects, such as teleportation, increased [[Equipment Stats|equipment bonuses]], and assistance in skills such as [[Smithing]] and [[Runecraft]]. Additionally, the Charge Orb spells may be used to imbue [[unpowered orb]]s with elemental magic, after which they may be used to make [[elemental staves]]. All enchantment spells make use of [[cosmic rune]]s. {|class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center; width:850px;" !class="unsortable"|Icon ! class="unsortable" |[[Mobile]]

icon !Spell !Level !class="unsortable"|[[Runes]] !XP ![[Members]] !Effect |- |[[File:Telekinetic Grab.png]] |[[File:Telekinetic Grab icon (mobile).png]] |[[Telekinetic Grab]] |33 |{{RuneReq|Law=1|Air=1}} |43 |{{members|no}} | style="text-align: left;" | Remotely takes an item laying on the ground or on a table. Can be cast through barriers such as fences and jail cell bars, but not through solid objects like doors or walls. |} ==Trivia== *Within the game cache, there are three unused spell icons that can be found ([[File:Unused standard spell 1.png]] [[File:Unused standard spell 2.png]] [[File:Unused standard spell 3.png]]). These were scrapped summoning spells from [[RuneScape Classic]] that utilised [[classicrsw:Life-Rune|life runes]], which were also scrapped. [[File:Restraint icon (mobile).png|right]] *There is also one unused mobile spell icon within the game cache, which is the icon for Restraint, a level 89 spell costing 5 Wrath, 10 Fire and 10 Earth runes per cast, capable of hitting up to 8 damage and being able to freeze a single opponent for 20 seconds. This spell was offered in the [[Poll:Revenant Cave Rewards: Revisited & Content Changes Poll|Revenant Cave Rewards: Revisited & Content Changes Poll]], but failed by 3.3% votes. {{Spellbooks}} {{Standard spellbook}}
